alert.note: Alert for Northeast Aroostook; Northern Penobscot; Northern Piscataquis; Northwest Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 25 at 8:21AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...An area of heavy snow will affect northeastern Piscataquis... Aroostook and north central Penobscot Counties... At 820 AM EDT...An area of heavy snow was over Northern Maine. Locations impacted include... Presque Isle, Caribou, Fort Kent, Madawaska, Fort Fairfield, Limestone, Van Buren, Eagle Lake, Allagash, Deboullie Mountain, Clayton Lake, Portage, Mapleton, Washburn, Mars Hill, Ashland, Easton, Woodland, Frenchville and Bridgewater. This includes the following highways... US Highway 1 between Blaine and Fort Kent. State Highway 11 between Masardis and Fort Kent. * Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a quarter mile in this area of heavy snow. * Sudden and brief snowfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour is occurring in this area of heavy snow. Icy roads are possible as the snow is falling atop a glaze of freezing rain and sleet. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling. A winter weather advisory is in effect for the area. Please monitor local media outlets and the National Weather Service for further statements.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Aroostook; Northern Penobscot; Northern Piscataquis; Northwest Aroostook
